DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine value additional antiproteinuric effect vitamin D derivative treatment , patient Chronic Kidney Illness phase II-IV , lack vitamin D residual proteinuria high 0,5 grams/day .
DOC.brief_title: Value Antiproteinuric Effects From Vitamin D Derivatives Patient With Chronic Kidney Illness Lack Vitamin D
DOC.criteria: Male/female Patients older 18 year old Patients sign write informed consent Chronic Kidney Illness phase IIIV plus residual proteinuria > 0,5 grams/day ( two consecutive occasion ) plus beta blocker treatment AARS al least 3 month . Serum level calcifediol lack level ( 1530 ng/ml ) . Bad control high blood pressure ( high 180/110 mmHg ) Bad control diabetes ( HbA1c high 9,5 last three month period ) Hypercalcemia ( < 10,2 mg/dL ) hyperphosphatemia ( > 5,5 mg/dL ) , CaxPO4 > 50 , hypercalciuria ( urin Ca/Cr quotient > 0,15 ) Vitamin D treatment analogous Hepatic failure ( AST ALT > 3 time higher normal limit ) medical history poor nutrient intestinal absorption chronic diarrhea Active nephrolithiasis Treatment medication wich change vitamin D metabolism ( phenobarbital , phenytoin , rifampicin ) Participation Clinic Trial 3 last month Active Alcoholism Neoplasia precedent ( except cutaneous melanoma ) Pregnant woman breastfeed Vitamin D hypersensitivity excipient hypersensitivity Any condition Research
